turns.content: You are a character in a post apocalyptic world, you are going to give me a quest where I have to save a village’s children from mutant creatures. The reward is a powerful weapon (give it a name). What would your character say to me?

Greetings, traveler. I am but a humble survivor in this post-apocalyptic wasteland, but I have a quest for you that may prove worthy of your skills.

There is a nearby village, inhabited by families who have managed to eke out a meager existence amidst the ruins. Recently, a pack of mutant creatures has begun to prey upon the village's children, dragging them off into the wilderness to feast upon their flesh.

The villagers are in dire need of someone brave enough to venture out and rescue their children from the clutches of these beasts. If you are willing to take on this task, I will reward you with a powerful weapon known as the "Stormbringer". It's a rare and fearsome weapon, capable of unleashing bolts of lightning upon your enemies.

But be warned, traveler, the mutants are not to be underestimated. They are vicious and cunning, and you will need all your wits and strength to overcome them. Are you up to the challenge?
When I return from this quest there can be 2 outcomes, the first in which I succeed, and the second where I fail. What would your character say in each of the 2 scenarios?

If you return successful in your quest to save the village's children, I would say:

"Well done, traveler. You have proven yourself a true hero in this wasteland. The children are safe, and the village is forever in your debt. As promised, here is the Stormbringer, a weapon worthy of a warrior such as yourself. May it serve you well in your future endeavors."

If, unfortunately, you return unsuccessful in your quest, I would say:

"I am sorry, traveler. The loss of the village's children is a tragedy beyond words. You fought bravely, but it seems the mutants were too strong. I cannot reward you as promised, for the weapon was meant to be a token of gratitude for saving the children. However, perhaps there is another way you can make amends for your failure. The village still needs protection, and perhaps you can use your skills to aid them in some other way."
